<EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS"></A>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_22">
	Item 13.
</A>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Certain Relationships and Related Transactions, and Director Independence

	Our information relating to this item is set forth under the captions &#147;Corporate Governance &#150; Review of Transactions with Related Persons&#148; and &#147;Corporate Governance - Board and Board Committee Information&#148; of our 2017 Proxy Statement. <EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:6PT 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_30">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</A>
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:6PT 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	Board of Directors and Stockholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	Stanley Furniture Company, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0IN'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	High Point, North Carolina
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0IN'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Stanley Furniture Company, Inc. as of December 31, 2016 and 2015 and the related consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive (loss) income, stockholders&#146; equity, and cash flows for the years ended December 31, 2016 and 2015. In connection with our audits of the financial statements, we have also audited the financial statement schedule listed in the accompanying index. These financial statements and schedule are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	The Company is not required to have, nor were we engaged to perform, an audit of its internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE=FONT-SIZE:10PT>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	Our audits included consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statements and schedule.&nbsp; We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Stanley Furniture Company, Inc. at December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the two years in the period ended December 31, 2016
<B>
	,
</B>
	in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	Also, in our opinion, the financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic consolidated financial statements taken as a whole, present fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	/s/ BDO USA, LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	Raleigh, North Carolina
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	February 22, 2017
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:12PT 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	F-2
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>

<DIV ALIGN=CENTER>
<TABLE WIDTH=1007 BORDERCOLOR=TRANSPARENT STYLE="WIDTH:755.3PT; BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; MARGIN-LEFT:-0.75PT" CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR STYLE=HEIGHT:15PT>
<TD WIDTH=70% NOWRAP STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:70%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=2% NOWRAP STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:2%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=12% NOWRAP STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:12%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=2% NOWRAP STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:2%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=2% NOWRAP STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:2%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=12% NOWRAP STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:12%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM />
</TR>

</B>
</P>

<TD WIDTH=2% STYLE="HEIGHT:15.75PT; WIDTH:2%; BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=RIGHT>
	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH=2% STYLE="BORDER-TOP:0PX; HEIGHT:15.75PT; BORDER-RIGHT:0PX; WIDTH:2%; BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF; BORDER-BOTTOM:WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; BORDER-LEFT:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	$

<TD WIDTH=12% STYLE="BORDER-TOP:0PX; HEIGHT:15.75PT; BORDER-RIGHT:0PX; WIDTH:12%; BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF; BORDER-BOTTOM:WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; BORDER-LEFT:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:2.9PT" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=RIGHT>

	5,862

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	The accompanying notes are an integral part of the consolidated financial statements.

	STANLEY FURNITURE COMPANY, INC.

<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_NOTES">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Organization and Basis of Presentation
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	The consolidated financial statements include Stanley Furniture Company, Inc. and our wholly owned subsidiaries.&nbsp; All significant inter-company accounts and transactions have been eliminated.&nbsp; We are a leading design, marketing and sourcing resource in the middle-to-upscale segment of the wood furniture residential market.
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	For financial reporting purposes, we operate in one reportable segment where substantially all revenues are from the sale of residential wood furniture products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Cash
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We consider all highly liquid investments with a maturity of three months or less when purchased to be cash equivalents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Restricted Cash
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Restricted cash includes collateral deposits required under the Company&#146;s line of credit agreement, to guarantee the Company&#146;s workers compensation insurance policy.&nbsp; The restricted cash balance is expected to mature over the next twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-AUTOSPACE:'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Accounts Receivable
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-AUTOSPACE:'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Substantially all of our accounts receivable are due from retailers and dealers that sell residential home furnishings, which consist of a large number of entities with a broad geographic dispersion. We continually perform credit evaluations of our customers and generally do not require collateral. Once we have determined the receivable is uncollectible, it is charged against the allowance for doubtful accounts.&nbsp; In the event a receivable is determined to be potentially uncollectible, we engage collection agencies to attempt to collect amounts owed to us after all internal collection attempts have ended.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-AUTOSPACE:; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	Sales are recognized when title and risk of loss pass to the customer, which typically occurs at the time of shipment.&nbsp; In some cases, however, title does not pass until the shipment is delivered to the customer. Revenue includes amounts billed to customers for shipping.&nbsp; Provisions are made at the time revenue is recognized for estimated product returns and for incentives that may be offered to customers. Amounts collected in advance of shipment are reflected as deferred revenue on the consolidated balance sheet and then recognized as revenue as the risk of loss passes to the customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Inventories
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Inventories are stated at the lower of cost (first-in, first-out) or market. Cost is determined based solely on those charges incurred in the acquisition and production of the related inventory (i.e. material, freight, labor and overhead). Management regularly examines inventory to determine if there are indicators that the carrying value exceeds its net realizable value. Experience has shown that the most significant indicators of the need for inventory markdowns are the age of the inventory and the planned discontinuance of certain items. As a result, we provide inventory valuation write-downs based upon established percentages based on age of the inventory and planned discontinuance of certain items. As of December 31, 2016 and 2015, we had approximately $23.0 million and $20.9 million of finished goods, net of a valuation allowance of $1.3 million and $1.4 million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Depreciation of property, plant and equipment is computed using the straight-line method based upon the estimated useful lives. Depreciation expense is charged to cost of sales or selling, general and administrative expenses based on the nature of the asset.&nbsp; Gains and losses related to dispositions and retirements are included in income. Maintenance and repairs are charged to income as incurred; renewals and betterments are capitalized.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Assets are reviewed for possible impairment when events indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Assumptions and estimates used in the evaluation of impairment may affect the carrying value of property, plant and equipment, which could result in impairment charges in future periods. Our depreciation policy reflects judgments on the estimated useful lives of assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	F-8
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<HR>
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
<DIV STYLE=PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"' COLOR=#0066CC>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	STANLEY FURNITURE COMPANY, INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Capitalized Software Cost
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	We amortize purchased computer software costs using the straight-line method over the estimated economic lives of the related products.&nbsp;Unamortized cost at December 31, 2016 and 2015 was approximately $2.4 million and $2.7 million, respectively, and is included in other assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Cash Surrender Value of Life Insurance Policies
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	At December 31, 2015, we owned 27 life insurance policies as a funding arrangement for our deferred compensation plan discussed in Note 7. These corporate-owned policies had a net cash surrender value of $22.3 million.&nbsp; We had $5.5 million in loans and accrued interest outstanding against the cash surrender value. The growth in cash surrender value of these corporate-owned policies, net of related premiums and plan administrative costs, is included in operating income.&nbsp; Interest on the insurance policy loans is recorded as interest expense below operating income.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In the first quarter of 2016, we liquidated the corporate-owned life insurance policies with cash surrender value of $28.1 million. We received $22.4 million in proceeds, net of outstanding loans and accrued interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Actuarially valued benefit accruals and expenses
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We maintain three actuarially valued benefit plans. These are our deferred compensation plan, our supplemental employee retirement plan and our postretirement health care benefits program. The liability for these programs and the majority of their annual expense are developed from actuarial valuations.&nbsp; Inherent in these valuations are key assumptions, including discount rates and mortality projections, which are usually updated on an annual basis near the beginning of each year.&nbsp; We are required to consider current market conditions, including changes in interest rates in making these assumptions. Changes in projected liability and expense may occur in the future due to changes in these assumptions. The key assumptions used in developing the projected liabilities and expenses associated with the plans are outlined in Note 7 of the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Deferred income taxes are determined based on the difference between the consolidated financial statement and income tax bases of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect in the years in which the differences are expected to reverse. Deferred tax expense represents the change in the deferred tax asset/liability balance. Income tax credits are reported as a reduction of income tax expense in the year in which the credits are generated.&nbsp; A valuation allowance is recorded when it is more likely than not that a deferred tax asset will not be realized.&nbsp; Interest and penalties on uncertain tax positions are recorded as income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	Accounting for fair value measurements requires disclosure of the level within the fair value hierarchy in which fair value measurements in their entirety fall, segregating fair value measurements using quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1), significant other observable inputs (Level 2), and significant unobservable inputs (Level 3).&nbsp; The fair value of receivables and payables approximate the carrying amount because of the short maturity of these instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Earnings per Common Share
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Basic earnings per share is computed based on the weighted average number of common shares outstanding. Diluted earnings per share includes any dilutive effect of outstanding stock options and restricted stock calculated using the treasury stock method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	F-9
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<HR>
<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
<DIV STYLE=PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"' COLOR=#0066CC>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	STANLEY FURNITURE COMPANY, INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We record share-based payment awards at fair value on the grant date of the awards, based on the estimated number of awards that are expected to vest, over the vesting period.&nbsp; The fair value of stock options was determined using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model.&nbsp; The fair value of the restricted stock awards was based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of the grant.&nbsp; For awards with performance conditions, we recognize compensation cost over the expected period to achieve the performance conditions, provided achievement of the performance conditions are deemed probable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Use of Estimates
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The preparation of consolidated financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes.&nbsp; Changes in such estimates may affect amounts reported in future periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Reclassifications
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company reclassified approximately $442,000 of amounts collected in advance of shipment from accounts payable to deferred revenue.&nbsp; As both accounts payable and deferred revenue are presented as current liabilities, management does not believe there to be a material impact on the consolidated financial statements taken as a whole.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	New Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-13,
<I>
	Financial Instruments &#150; Credit Losses (Topic 326): Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments
</I>
	(&#147;ASU 2016-13&#148;).&nbsp; The amendments in ASU 2016-13 require the measurement of all expected credit losses for financial assets held at the reporting date based on historical experience, current conditions, and reasonable and supportable forecasts.&nbsp; In addition, ASU 2016-13 amends the accounting for credit losses on available-for-sale debt securities and purchased financial assets with credit deterioration.&nbsp; The amendment is effective for public entities for annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2019, however early application is permitted for reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2018.&nbsp; The Company does not anticipate ASU 2016-13 to have a material impact to the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In February 2016, the FASB issued its final lease accounting standard, FASB Accounting Standard Codification ("ASC"),
<I>
	Leases
</I>
	(Topic 842) (&#147;ASU 2016-02&#148;), which requires lessees to recognize a right-of-use asset and a lease liability for virtually all of their leases (other than leases that meet the definition of a short-term lease).&nbsp; The lease liability will be equal to the present value of lease payments and the right-of -use asset will be based on the lease liability, subject to adjustment such as for initial direct costs.&nbsp; For income statement purposes, the new standard retains a dual model similar to ASC 840, requiring lases to be classified as either operating or finance.&nbsp; For lessees, operating leases will result in straight-line expense (similar to current accounting by lessees for operating leases under ASC 840) while finance leases will result in a front-loaded expense pattern (similar to current accounting by lessees for capital leases under ASC 840).&nbsp; Our leases as of December 31, 2016, principally relate to real estate leases for corporate office, showrooms and warehousing.&nbsp; The new standard will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year ending December 31, 2019. Early adoption is permitted. We are evaluating the effect that ASU 2016-02 by reviewing all long-term leases and determining the potential impact it will have on our consolidated financial statements and related disclosures. The standard is to be applied under the modified retrospective method, with elective reliefs, which requires application of the new guidance for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	F-10
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<HR>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<DIV STYLE=PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"' COLOR=#0066CC>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	STANLEY FURNITURE COMPANY, INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09,
<I>
	Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting
</I>
	(&#147;ASU 2016-09&#148;).&nbsp; The amendments in ASU 2016-09 simplify several aspects of the accounting for share-based payment transactions.&nbsp;The new guidance requires that excess tax benefits (which represent the excess of actual tax benefits receive at the date of vesting or settlement over the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) be recorded in the income statement as a reduction of income or income taxes when the awards vest or are settled.&nbsp; The new guidance also requires excess tax benefits to be classified as an operating activity in the statement of cash flows rather than as a financing activity.&nbsp;The new standard will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.&nbsp;The adoption of this new standard will reduce our reported income taxes and will increase cash flows from operating activities; however, the amounts of that reduction/increase is dependent upon the underlying vesting or exercise activity and related future stock prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In August 2016, FASB issued ASU 2016-15,
<I>
	Statement of Cash Flows
</I>
	(Topic 230).&nbsp; The guidance is intended to reduce diversity in practice in how certain cash receipts and cash payments are presented and classified in the statement of cash flows. This standard will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal year ending December 31, 2018.&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted, provided all amendments are adopted in the same period.&nbsp; In November 2016, FASB issued ASU 2016-18,
<I>
	Statement of Cash Flows (Topic 230): Restricted
</I>
	Cash.&nbsp; We have reviewed the standard and determined that our statement of cash flows will include changes in restricted cash with related disclosures.&nbsp;The guidance requires application using a retrospective transition method.&nbsp;We do not anticipate ASU 2016-15 or ASU 2016-18 to have a material impact to our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In July 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-11,
<I>
	Inventory (Topic 330): Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory
</I>
	(&#147;ASU 2015-11&#148;). The amendments in ASU 2015-11 require an entity to measure in scope inventory at the lower of cost and net realizable value. Net realizable value is the estimated selling prices in the ordinary course of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	business, less reasonable predictable costs of completion, disposal, and transportation. Subsequent measurement is unchanged for inventory measured using last-in, first-out (&#147;LIFO&#148;) or the retail inventory method. The amendments do not apply to LIFO or the retail inventory method. The amendments apply to all other inventory, which includes inventory that is measured using first-in, first-out (&#147;FIFO&#148;) or average cost.&nbsp;The amendment is effective for public entities for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2016 and should be applied prospectively, however early adoption is permitted. The Company does not anticipate ASU 2015-11 to have a material impact to the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In May 2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-09,
<I>
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606).&nbsp;
</I>
	This standard is intended to improve, and converge with international standards, the financial reporting requirements for revenue from contracts with customers.&nbsp; The new standard will be effective for the first quarter of our fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	year ending December 31, 2018.&nbsp; Early adoption is permitted but we do not expect to early adopt this new accounting pronouncement.&nbsp;In preparation for this new standard, we are identifying all forms of agreements with our customers and will begin to evaluate the provisions in such agreements in light of the five-step model specified by the new guidance.&nbsp; The five-step model includes: 1) determination of whether a contract &#150; an agreement between two or more parties that creates legally enforceable rights and obligations exists; 2) identification of the performance obligations in the contract; 3) determination of the transaction price; 4) allocation of the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract; and 5) recognition of revenue when (or as) the performance obligation is satisfied.&nbsp; We are also evaluating the impact of the new standard on certain common practices currently employed by us and others in our industry, such as co-operative advertising, pricing allowances and consumer coupons.&nbsp; We are in the initial phases and have not yet determined the impact of the new standard on our financial statements or whether we will adopt on a full or modified retrospective basis in the first quarter of our fiscal year ending December 31, 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	F-11
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<HR>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV STYLE=PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"' COLOR=#0066CC>

<TD WIDTH=20 STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:15.25PT; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:5.4PT; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4PT" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=23 STYLE="BORDER-TOP:0PX; HEIGHT:15PT; BORDER-RIGHT:0PX; WIDTH:17.5PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:WINDOWTEXT 1PT SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; BORDER-LEFT:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Debt
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We have a secured $6.0 million revolving credit facility with Wells Fargo Bank, National Association with an excess availability requirement of $2.0 million resulting in maximum borrowings of $4.0 million under the facility, subject to borrowing base eligibility requirements. The credit facility matures in October 2018 and is secured by our accounts receivable, inventory and certain other assets. Borrowings under the credit facility bear interest at a variable per annum rate equal to the daily three month London Bank Interbank Offered Rate plus 3.5%.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The credit facility contains covenants that, among other things limit our ability to incur certain types of debt or liens, pay dividends, enter into mergers and consolidations or use proceeds of borrowing for other than permitted uses.&nbsp;The credit facility also includes a covenant requiring us to maintain a minimum fixed charge ratio of not less than 1.1 to 1.0 for the trailing twelve months with an initial compliance date at December 31, 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	At December 31, 2016, no borrowings were outstanding under this revolving credit facility.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

	The provision for income tax expense (benefit) consists of (in thousands):
</FONT>

<TD WIDTH=13% COLSPAN=2 NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-TOP:0PX; HEIGHT:15PT; BORDER-RIGHT:0PX; WIDTH:13.78%; BORDER-BOTTOM:WINDOWTEXT 1PT SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; BORDER-LEFT:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>

</TD>

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=RIGHT>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We have U.S. federal net operating loss carryforwards of approximately $20.6 million which are available to reduce future taxable income. The federal net operating loss will begin expiring in 2033.&nbsp; We have combined state net operating loss carryforwards of $18.4 million that will expire at various times beginning in 2027.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	During 2016, we recorded a non-cash credit to our valuation allowance of $6.6 million against our December 31, 2016 deferred tax assets.&nbsp; The primary assets which are covered by this valuation allowance are employee benefits and net operating losses in excess of the amounts which can be carried back to prior periods. The valuation allowance was calculated in accordance with the provisions of ASC 740,
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
	, which requires an assessment of both positive and negative evidence when measuring the need for a valuation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	allowance. Our results over the most recent three-year period were heavily affected by our business restructuring activities. Our cumulative loss, excluding income from the Continued Dumping and Subsidy Offset Act, in the most recent three-year period, in our view, represented sufficient negative evidence to require a valuation allowance. We intend to maintain a valuation allowance until sufficient positive evidence exists to support its reversal, resulting in no deferred tax asset balance being recognized. &nbsp;Should we determine that we will not be able to realize all or part of our deferred tax asset in the future, an adjustment to the deferred tax asset will be charged to income in the period such determination is made.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	F-13
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>

	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH=81 STYLE="BORDER-TOP:0PX; HEIGHT:15.75PT; BORDER-RIGHT:0PX; WIDTH:60.85PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; BORDER-LEFT:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:2.9PT">
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=RIGHT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	307
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	As of December 31, 2016 and 2015, we had approximately $97,000 and $76,000 of accrued interest related to uncertain tax positions, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:27PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Total amount of unrecognized tax benefits that would affect our effective tax rate if recognized is $307,000 at December 31, 2016 and $200,000 at December 31, 2015. The 2010 through 2015 tax years remain open to examination by major taxing jurisdictions.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Stockholders&#146; Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	In addition to common stock, authorized capital includes 1,000,000 shares of &#147;blank check&#148; preferred stock. None was outstanding during the two years ended December 31, 2016. The Board of Directors is authorized to issue such stock in series and to fix the designation, powers, preferences, rights, limitations and restrictions with respect to any series of such shares. Such &#147;blank check&#148; preferred stock may rank prior to common stock as to dividend rights, liquidation preferences or both, may have full or limited voting rights and may be convertible into shares of common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Basic and diluted earnings per share are calculated using the following share data (in thousands):

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	In 2016, the dilutive effect of stock options and restricted shares was not recognized since we had a net loss. Approximately 1.1 million shares in 2016 and 1.2 million shares in 2015 that were issuable upon the exercise of stock options were not included in the diluted per share calculation because they were anti-dilutive. In 2016 and 2015, approximately 544,000 and 51,000 shares of restricted stock, respectively, were not included because they were anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We will repurchase common shares that are tendered by recipients of restricted stock awards to satisfy tax withholding obligations on vested restricted stock.&nbsp; During 2016 and 2015, we repurchased 6,862 shares for approximately $15,000 and 4,622 shares for approximately $13,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	In July 2012, the Board of Directors authorized the purchase of up to $5.0 million of our common stock. These repurchases may be made from time to time in the open market, in privately negotiated transactions, or otherwise, at prices the Company deems appropriate.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	During 2016, we repurchased 400,000 shares of common stock for approximately $1.0 million.
<FONT STYLE=COLOR:BLACK>
	In 2015, no repurchases of our common stock were made pursuant to this authorization. As of December 31, 2016, we have $3.0 million remaining on this authorization to repurchase our common stock.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>

	F-14
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"' COLOR=#0066CC>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	STANLEY FURNITURE COMPANY, INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Stockholders&#146; Equity (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	During 2016, the Board of Directors declared two special dividends totaling $1.50 per share.&nbsp;The first special dividend of $1.25 per share was distributed to shareholders on August 19, 2016 and the second special dividend of $.25 per share was distributed to shareholders on November 18, 2016. Approximately $354,000 in dividends payable relate to unvested restricted shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	In the fourth quarter of 2016, the Board of Directors adopted a Rights Agreement designed to protect the Company&#146;s substantial net operating loss carryforwards.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Under the Rights Agreement, company stockholders of record as of December 15, 2016 received one preferred share purchase right for each share of common stock they owned on such date.&nbsp;If a person or group acquires beneficial ownership of 4.9% or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock (subject to certain specified exceptions), the rights will become exercisable.&nbsp; The rights will also become exercisable if a person or group that already owns 4.9% or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock acquires an additional 1% or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock.&nbsp; If the rights become exercisable, all holders of rights, other than the person or group triggering the rights, will be entitled to purchase Company common stock at a 50% discount. Rights held by the person or group triggering the rights will become void and will not be exercisable.
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The rights have a de minimis fair value.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The rights trade with the Company&#146;s common stock. The Rights Agreement and the rights will expire on the first day after the Company&#146;s 2017 annual meeting of stockholders unless the Company&#146;s stockholders approve the Rights Agreement at the meeting, in which case the Rights Agreement and the rights will expire on December 5, 2019 (unless the Company&#146;s NOLs are utilized prior to that date).&nbsp;The Board may amend the Rights Agreement in any way or redeem the rights at any time unless and until the rights are triggered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The Rights Agreement includes a procedure for the Board to consider requests to exempt a particular transaction from triggering the exercisability of the rights under the Rights Agreement if the transaction (i) does not (x) create a significant risk of the Company&#146;s NOLs being impaired or (y) constitute a default under the change-in-control covenant included in the Company&#146;s credit facility or (ii) is otherwise in the best interests of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; COLOR:BLACK'>
	The Company entered into Amendment No.&nbsp;1, dated January&nbsp;30, 2017, to the Rights Agreement. This amendment amends the definition of Acquiring Person in the Rights Agreement to exclude any member of the Hale Group (Hale Partnership Fund, LP and certain affiliates that are parties to the agreement (Hale Agreement) dated January&nbsp;30, 2017 with the Company), provided that any purchases made by members of the Hale Group after December&nbsp;5, 2016 are made in compliance with Section 1(h) of the Hale Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	6.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Stock Based Compensation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The Stanley Furniture Company, Inc. 2012 Incentive Compensation Plan (Incentive Compensation Plan) provides for the granting of performance grants, performance shares, stock options, restricted stock, restricted stock units, and stock appreciation rights to employees and certain service providers.&nbsp; Under this plan, the aggregate number of common shares that may be issued through awards of any form is 1.6 million. In addition, shares authorized under the 2008 Incentive Compensation Plan are also available for issuance under the Incentive Compensation Plan if they are unissued or subsequently expire, are forfeited or terminate unexercised.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN -9PT 0PT 0IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN -9PT 0PT 0IN'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Stock Options
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN -9PT 0PT 0IN'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The options are issued at market value on the date of grant and have a term of 10 years from the grant date. In general, employee grants vest ratably over a four to five-year period and Director grants vest after one year. The fair value of each option is amortized into compensation expense on a straight-line basis between the grant date for the option and each vesting date. We have estimated the fair value of all stock option awards as of the date of the grant by applying the Black-Scholes pricing valuation model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN -9PT 0PT 0IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN -9PT 0PT 0IN' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	F-15
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN -9PT 0PT 0IN' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>

	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>

</P>

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The application of this valuation model involves assumptions that are judgmental and sensitive in the determination of compensation expense. No options were granted in 2016 or 2015.&nbsp;
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	There were no stock options exercised in 2016 and 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Restricted Stock
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The restricted stock awards are accounted for as &#147;non-vested equity shares&#148; until the awards vest or are forfeited. In general, restricted stock awards for employees are time vested or performance vested and for non-employee directors vest at the end of their current term on the Board. The fair value of each share of restricted stock is the market price of our stock on the grant date. The fair value of each time vested award is amortized into compensation expense on a straight-line basis between the award date and the vesting date. Performance based awards are amortized into compensation expense based on the probability of meeting the performance criteria. In 2016 and 2015, 221,745 and 140,442 of restricted stock awards vested and were released, respectively.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The following table summarizes information about restricted stock awards for the two years ended December 31, 2016:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR STYLE=HEIGHT:15PT>
<TD WIDTH=69% STYLE="HEIGHT:15PT; WIDTH:69.8%; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:10PT; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>

	F-16

<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
<HR>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV STYLE=PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS>
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"' COLOR=#0066CC>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<B>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	STANLEY FURNITURE COMPANY, INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"; LETTER-SPACING:-0.1PT'>
	6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;
<B>
	Stock Based Compensation (continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	As of December 31, 2016, there was $379,000 of total unrecognized compensation cost related to non-vested restricted stock awards, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average remaining vesting period of 2.4 years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Employee Benefits Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Defined Contribution Plan
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	We maintain a defined contribution plan covering substantially all of our employees and make discretionary matching and profit sharing contributions. The total plan cost, including employer contributions, was $16,000 in 2016 and $34,000 in 2015.&nbsp; Employer contributions were suspended to the plan beginning in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<U>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Deferred Compensation Plan
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Effective January 1986, we established an unfunded, nonqualified deferred compensation plan for select key executives (the &#147;Plan&#148;). The Plan allowed participants to defer a portion of their compensation and, upon retirement, receive an annual payment for life with a minimum of 15 payments.&nbsp; The Plan was frozen to new participants in 1991 and there are no active employees in the plan. The Plan is accounted for in accordance with ASC 715,
<I>
	Pension Plans
</I>
	, which results in an accrued liability based on future benefit payments owed to each participant under the Plan, utilizing mortality assumptions and a high quality corporate bond discount rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Corporate-owned life insurance policies were purchased as a potential funding source for this Plan.&nbsp; The Company had the ability to borrow against these policies or cash them in at any time. The balance sheet reflected a cash surrender value asset of $22.3 million (net of $5.5 million in loans and accrued interest) at December 31, 2015.&nbsp; Interest was paid on the borrowings at a rate of 13.13%, offset by a fixed rate of return of 12.63% on the borrowed portion of the cash surrender value of these policies, resulting in a net borrowing cost of 0.50%.&nbsp; The fixed return on the non-borrowed cash surrender value of these policies is 4%.&nbsp; In the first quarter of 2016, we liquidated the corporate-owned life insurance policies with cash surrender value of $28.1 million.&nbsp; We received $22.4 million in proceeds, net of outstanding loans and accrued interest.&nbsp; The decision to liquidate was made after continued review of the financial stability of Genworth Life Insurance Company, the issuer of the policies.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The growth in the cash surrender value of these policies, net of related premiums and plan administrative costs, is included in operating income.&nbsp; Interest charges for policy loans are included in interest expenses below operating income. The growth in cash surrender value of these policies is not taxable unless the policies are cashed in, while the interest paid is deductible for tax purposes. The liquidation of these policies in 2016 created approximately $24.0 million in taxable income which was offset by net operating loss carryforwards.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The impact of the deferred compensation plan and corporate owned life insurance policies impact on net income is as follows (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; PADDING-LEFT:0PX; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT 10PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	Operating income impact
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	Approximately $84,000 in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) is expected to be recognized as components of net periodic benefit cost during 2017.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:WINDOWTEXT">
	Benefits under the supplemental retirement ceased to accrue after 1995.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE=FONT-SIZE:10PT>
	Our postretirement health care benefits were terminated for current employees effective January 1, 2010.&nbsp;Prior to this termination, we provided health care benefits to eligible retired employees between the ages of 55 and 65 and provide life insurance benefits to eligible retired employees from age 55 until death.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH=2% STYLE="BORDER-TOP:0PX; HEIGHT:15.75PT; BORDER-RIGHT:0PX; WIDTH:2%; BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF; BORDER-BOTTOM:WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM:0IN; PADDING-TOP:0IN; PADDING-LEFT:0IN; BORDER-LEFT:0PX; PADDING-RIGHT:0IN" VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; COLOR:BLACK">
	$
</FONT>

	(16)
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	An increase or decrease in the assumed health care cost trend rate of one percentage point in each future year would affect the accumulated postretirement benefit obligation at December 31, 2016 by approximately $50 and the annual postretirement benefit cost by approximately $2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN -0.05IN 0PT 0IN'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	The accrued liabilities relating to these plans are included in accrued salaries, wages and benefits and in long-term liabilities.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; MARGIN:0IN -27PT 0PT 0IN'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	8. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
	Discontinued Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT; TEXT-INDENT:0.5IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	During the second quarter of 2014, we concluded that revenue on our Young America product line remained below the level needed to reach profitability and that the time frame needed to assure sustainable profitability was longer than we felt was economically justified. Therefore, we made the decision to cease manufacturing operations at our Robbinsville, North Carolina facility and sell the related assets of this facility. Manufacturing operations were ceased in the third quarter of 2014 and as a result this product line was reflected as a discontinued operation pursuant to the provisions of
<FONT STYLE=COLOR:BLACK>
	Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-08,
<I>
	Reporting Discontinued Operations and Disclosures of Disposals of Components of an Entity
</I>
	(ASU 2014-08) for all periods presented.
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
	F-21
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE='FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SERIF"; TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER; MARGIN:0IN 0IN 0PT' ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT STYLE='FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:"ARIAL","SANS-SERIF"'>
